intro: Verbascum transjordanicum, commonly known as the Jordanian mullein, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, growing in open areas with full sun exposure. Verbascum transjordanicum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
